concept.title: REVCLOUD command
concept.shortdesc: Creates a polyline in the shape of a revision cloud.

conbody.p: Create a closed polyline in the shape of a revision cloud. Choose from a combination of options including rectangular, polygonal, freehand, and entity.

section.title: Methods to create a revision cloud
section.p: There are four methods to begin creating a revision cloud:

dlentry.dd: Begin creating a rectangular revision cloud by specifying a corner of the rectangle then:
Additonal options: [Arc length/Entity/Rectangular/Polygonal/Freehand/Style]
Specify the opposite corner of the rectangle. The revision cloud is drawn parallel to the x and y axes.
Begin creating a polygonal revision cloud by specifying a vertex of the polygon then:
Additonal options: [Arc length/Entity/Rectangular/Polygonal/Freehand/Style]
Specify the next point of the polygon.
You can continue adding unlimited vertices until you press Enter to end the command.
Additional option: [Undo]
Begin creating a freehand revision cloud by specifying a start point then:
Additonal options: [Arc length/Entity/Rectangular/Polygonal/Freehand/Style]
Drag the cursor to add revision cloud segments. Continue adding segments until you:
Pass the cursor over the start point to create a closed revision cloud.
Or
Right-click to create an open revision cloud then:

Specify whether you want to change the direction of the revision cloud.
Yes: The direction of the arc segments is reversed.
No: The direction of the arc segment is retained.
Begin creating a revision cloud by selecting an existing entity to convert to a revision cloud then:

Specify whether you want to change the direction of the revision cloud.
Yes: The direction of the arc segments is reversed.
No: The direction of the arc segment is retained.
Entities can be open or closed. The original entity is erased.

section.title: Options within the REVCLOUD command
section.p: After you begin creating a revision cloud, the following options may be available.

dlentry.dd: Specify the shortest and longest length for the arcs that form the cloud.
Specify the minimum length of the arcs.
The minimum arc length is stored in the REVCLOUDMINARCLENGTH system variable.
Specify the maximum length of the arcs.
The minimum arc length is stored in the REVCLOUDMAXARCLENGTH system variable.

Specify the arc style to use for the revision cloud.
Normal: The polyline making up the cloud has a uniform width.
Calligraphy: The polyline has a varying width (tapered polyarcs) to simulate a calligraphic look.
The arc style is stored in the REVCLOUDARCSTYLE system variable.
Undo the last segment in a polygonal revision cloud and continue drawing from the previous segment.
